definition: strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously

sentences.english: He would eventually confess to the murders under the threat of torture.
sentences.chinese: 迫于严刑的威胁，他最后承认了所犯谋杀罪行。

sentences.english: Shadow with the general belt XingShu apologise to see snow had been tortured.
sentences.chinese: 影佐将军带刑书媛来见已经被严刑拷打过的雪儿。

sentences.english: Whoso destroys it in himself and others, him she punishes with the sternest tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 那自毁毁人者，她必以严刑惩罚。

sentences.english: Otherwise, their punishments and rewards were not sufficiently trusted. Credibility must be established before the moment of need;
sentences.chinese: 否则，即使采取严刑重赏也是不足以令人信服的。

sentences.english: Cheney was unapologetic about the harsh interrogation methods that he had approved, such as waterboarding.
sentences.chinese: 切尼对自己支持的诸如水刑的严刑逼供并未有悔意。

sentences.english: The subject of torture was depicted with a religious theme.
sentences.chinese: 严刑拷打被以一种宗教主题的形式描绘出来。

sentences.english: The confession was made under torture.
sentences.chinese: 这份供词是严刑逼供得来的。

sentences.english: Facing too, the field of torture, JiDePing silence to die rather than give in.
sentences.chinese: 面对太田的严刑拷打，季德平沉默以对宁死不屈。

sentences.english: The soldiers endured many kinds of torture when they were in the hands of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这些士兵在敌人的手中遭受了各样的严刑拷打。

sentences.english: Detainees are routinely subjected to severe beatings, torture and other ill-treatment .
sentences.chinese: 被监禁的人时时受到严刑苦打与凌虐。

sentences.english: Chen angry, let a person find the leading sunspot, torture.
sentences.chinese: 陈大恼羞成怒，让人找到领头的黑子，严刑拷问。

sentences.english: During a certain period of time in history, severe punishments were much more effective that lax policies.
sentences.chinese: 在一定的历史时期，使用严刑峻法比宽松政策更有效。
巴林一名博主被严刑拷打。

definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
corporal punishment (such as castration or amputation)
an execution/to put sb to death
